## Summary

In this script we prep data frames of total global amount of impacted habitat per terrestrial species.


## Setup

Load libraries

```{r setup, include=FALSE}

library(tidyverse)
library(here)
library(terra)
library(parallel)
library(strex)
library(janitor)
library(sf)
library(tools)
library(glue)

source(here("src/directories.R"))

source(here("src/spatial.R"))

aoh_dir <- file.path(rdsi_raw_data_dir, "AOH_eyres/reprojected_mol_csv/")

biodiv_dir <- file.path(rdsi_dir, "biodiversity_impacts")
```

Bind all chunked data together, tidy, and save

```{r}

impact_df <-  purrr::map_df(list.files(file.path(biodiv_dir, "int/aoh_impacts_terrestrial/"), full.names = TRUE), readRDS) %>%
  rename(sciname = species_full)

length(unique(impact_df$sciname)) # 27911

spp_habs_df <- impact_df %>%
  distinct(sciname, total_hab_area = hab_area)

write.csv(spp_habs_df, here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/int/terrestrial_habitat_areas.csv"), row.names = FALSE)

test <- data.frame(dups = duplicated(spp_habs_df$sciname)) %>%
  filter(dups == TRUE) # good, 0 duplicates
  

# now lets clean up the data a bit 

all_spp_list <- readRDS(here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/data/iucn/eyres_iucn_spp.rds")) %>%
  dplyr::select(sciname = scientific_name, order = order_name, iucn_rl_cat = category) %>%
  filter(!is.na(sciname))


impact_df_tidy <- impact_df %>%
    group_by(sciname, diet, fcr_type, allocation, crop_ingredient) %>%
  summarise(impact_total = sum(impact_total, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  mutate(aoh_filepath = paste0(aoh_dir, sciname), 
         feed_filepath = sprintf(here("prep/02_feed/output/resampled/%s/%s/%s_%s_A.tif"), diet, fcr_type, crop_ingredient, allocation)) %>%
  rename("ingredient" = "crop_ingredient") %>%
  mutate(sciname = str_replace_all(sciname, "_", " ")) %>%
  left_join(all_spp_list, by = c("sciname")) %>%
  left_join(spp_habs_df, by = "sciname") %>%
  mutate(impact_total = ifelse(is.na(impact_total), 0, impact_total))

test <- data.frame(sciname = setdiff(all_spp_list$sciname, impact_df_tidy$sciname)) %>%
  left_join(all_spp_list)

species_list <- c(unique(impact_df_tidy$sciname))

writeLines(species_list, here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/int/assessed_species_list.txt"))

hab_areas <- impact_df_tidy %>% ungroup() %>% distinct(sciname, total_hab_area) %>%
  group_by(sciname) %>%
  filter(total_hab_area == max(total_hab_area)) %>%
  ungroup()

test <- impact_df_tidy %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  group_by(sciname, diet, fcr_type, allocation) %>%
  summarise(impact_total = sum(impact_total, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  left_join(spp_habs_df) %>% 
  mutate(prop_impacted = impact_total/total_hab_area)

## highest total proportional impact is Liolaemus gravenhorstii, commonly known as Gravenhorst's tree iguana. ~1.7% of its habitat is impacted under plant-dominant, regular, economic. 
```


Bind species' tolerances to the full aoh impacted dataframe. 

```{r}
ag_suitability <- readRDS(here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/int/terrestrial_spp_habitat_suitability.rds"))

aoh_df <- impact_df_tidy %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  left_join(., ag_suitability, by = c("sciname" = "species")) %>%
  rename(suitability = cropland_suitability) %>%
  mutate(vulnerability = 1 - suitability)

saveRDS(aoh_df, here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/output/aoh_terrestrial_impact.rds")) # save as rds to save space

test <- aoh_df %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  dplyr::select(spp_type, sciname) %>%
  group_by(spp_type) %>%
  summarise(n_distinct(sciname)) ## ok missing a lot of species... is this because they aren't vulnerable? 

length(unique(all_spp_list$sciname)) # 31596
length(unique(aoh_df$sciname)) # 27911
# missing 3685 species...

test_ag <- ag_suitability %>% 
  group_by(spp_type, cropland_suitability) %>%
  summarise(n_distinct(species))

2927 + 626 + 1003 + 627 # 5183 not vulnerable

31596 - 3685 # 27911 total species accounted for... 

## paper reports: 

length(unique(ag_suitability$species)) # 31596
ag_suitability %>% filter(cropland_suitability != 1) %>% pull(species) %>% unique() %>% length() # 26413

# how many do we assess? 31596... but only have 27911 in our dataset after running everything??

## filter for our missing spp and see their suitability


missing_spp <- setdiff(all_spp_list$sciname, impact_df_tidy$sciname)


test_ag <- ag_suitability %>% 
  filter(species %in% c(missing_spp)) # ok... majority of them should theoretically be impacted... does this just mean there was literally no overlap at all? I think so... explore this further in the week.


all_spp_list <- readRDS(here("prep/03_prep_spp_habitats/data/iucn/eyres_iucn_spp.rds")) %>%
  dplyr::select(sciname = scientific_name, order = order_name, iucn_rl_cat = category, spp_type) %>%
  group_by(spp_type) %>%
  summarise(n_distinct(sciname))

all_spp_list
```

Look at soybean impacts:

```{r}
soybean_imps <- aoh_df %>%
  filter(fcr_type == "regular",
         str_detect(ingredient, "Soybean"),
         allocation == "economic") %>%
  group_by(diet, fcr_type, allocation, ingredient) %>%
  summarise(total_impact = sum(impact_total, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  ungroup()



```
